lines.text: Where's the basement?
Downstairs.
Hey! Which way is the alley?
Out in the street.
Dinner! Oh, Mr. Nick? Dinner is served.

[enters and sits down]
Well... looks good
[smells the fake dinner]
smells good, and I better it probably tastes good.
Oh, you're going to like this. It's just like mother used to make.
Oh, it's better than that.

[grins]
Well, if it's that good,
[puts dinner on two plates and gives one to Stan, one to Ollie]
you eat it.
[look back dumb founded]

[still dumbstruck]
I beg your pardon?

[takes gun out]
You heard me! I said eat!

[hands fork over to Stan]
Here! I can wait.

[hands Ollie a second fork]
Here you go, Dizzy.

[takes it and replies very weakly]
Thank you.

[grins]
You're welcome.
Just like mother used to make, eh, Dopey?
[nods weakly]
Only better, right, Dizzy?
[nods weakly]

[smirks]
Have a meatball, Dizzy.

[very weakly]
Thank you.

[smirking]
You're welcome.

[shows horn]
What's the idea of bring this along?
Oh, my professor said, if I don't practice I might lose my lip.
Uh-huh, and if you do practice, you'll lose your neck.
[rings Oliver's apartment doorbell]

[inside the bell rings, blows off the wall and hits Ollie in the head]
Ooh!
[to Stan]
See who that is!
Having trouble, Mr. Hardy?
Trouble? Well, the room's all topsy turvy.
Well, just have a look at mine.

[follows her into the apartment]
All right.
I don't know what happened, I just went to my fridge this morning, and look what happened!
[opens it, and music starts playing. She shuts it after a moment]
And that's not all, just have a look at the radio.
[points to it, where it is covered with frost]
Oh! Well, I'll give that guy a piece of your mind too.

[calling Oliver's room]
Mr. Laurel? There's a Professor O'Brien here to see you.
Oh, that's swell! You know, he's been expecting me.
Well, here's another nice bucket of suds you've pickled me in!

[Referring to the ice bag]
What have you got in this?
Nothing.
Well, what good is an ice bag without any ice?
Well, we haven't any ice.

[Exasperated]
Well, go put some cold water in it, so I can put it on my... head.

[Bewildered]
Well, I didn't know.
Who was it?
It was the doctor.

[Annoyed]
Well, what did he say?
He said he'd be up here in about a quarter of an hour or fifteen minutes, as quick as he can get here.

[to Ollie]
You know, your nerves are getting to look better already.

[to Stan and Ollie]
Excuse me, jitterbugs. Where you heading for?
[last lines]

[at the jail after Hardy beats him up]
What cell is Nick Grainger in?
Twenty-four.
Well, here's two more for him.
Well, here's another nice mess you've gotten me into...
But I couldn't help it...
[cries, fade out]

[to Stan, feeling crazed from the incessant deafening cacophony of the brass instruments and Klaxon horns blasting off all around him, and unable to understand why Stan seems so calm and unaffected]
Doesn't this noise BOTHUH you?

[off-handedly]
No, it doesn't... it just goes in this ear and out of the other one. Doesn't bother me a bit.
[lifts the trumpet he was working on and blows loudly through it]
Hawwwwwnnnnkkkk!
Say, by the way, you haven't had any goat's milk
I'm glad you reminded me.
I'm glad I did too.
Get me some.
I will. It's a good thing for your nerves and that's what you need right now.
[gets up, causing the table to swerve and bump Ollie; Stan returns with a cup]
How much milk do you want?
That will be plenty.
Okay.
By the way, you know how to milk a goat, don't you?
Sure, just the same as milking a cow. You hold the cup in this hand
[holds it in his left]
And you take the other hand by the tail
[his right]
And you go like that.
[makes an up and down pumping motion]
'Course, if you're lefthanded, you hold the cup in the other hand. But I always hold it in this hand...

[takes the cup from Stan and stands up]
"Hold the tail in that hand."
[imitates Stan's pumping motion]
Such ignorance.

"Old Mother Hubbard went to the cupboard, to get her poor dog a bone. But when she came there, the cupboard was bare, and so the poor dog had none." Poor dog. "She went to the bakers to buy him some bread, but when she came back, the poor dog was..." Ah, gee. "She took a clean dish to get him some tripe, but when she came back, he was smoking her pipe."
[looks bewildered]
How can a dead dog smoke...?
[sees Ollie has fallen asleep]

Don't you realize the effect the sound of a horn has on me? It makes me fighting mad. In fact, it gives me the urge to kill. I could take a body and break it in two and throw it. The very thought of it makes me tremble all over!
Well I wouldn't get excited...
WHO'S EXCITED?
Well, here's another nice bucket of suds you got me into.
I couldn't help it, Dizzy.

What do you mean you couldn't help... and don't call me Dizzy, Dopey! It was your idea to get us on this boat. I'll never listen to another idea of yours as long as I live. And if I ever get out of this, I'll use my own judgment from then on.
Well what are we going to do about something to eat?
[cries]
fake it.
What do you mean fake it?
We'll serve him a synthetic meal.
But we haven't got anything.
You don't understand. We'll substitute things. For instance, we'll uh... we'll use this string for spaghetti, and-and we'll use this soap for grated cheese and so on and so on.
But he can't eat that, it'll poison him.
[cries]
So what? If we don't get Old Nick, Nick Junior will get us.
[makes his hand into the shape of a gun to illustrate]
You're right, Ollie. Self-reservation is the last law of... average.
Dopey, you amaze me.
Thank you, Dizzy. I get an idea...

[shoves him off]
Go ahead and fix the fire.
What'll we use for tomato sauce?
Look around and see if you can find anything that looks like it.
How about this red paint?
Perfect. Heat it up.
Say, can you use this sponge for anything?
Yeah, we can cut it up and use it for meatballs.
You can talk from now until Doomsday, but you're not gonna get me on the ocean. Hornamania or no Hornamania.
Do you two realize you've got a nice reward coming to you for this?
What do you mean 'we two'? I'M going to get the reward.
Well aren't you gonna split it?
Certainly not. He's going to treat me right, aren't you, Ollie?
Why certainly.
And take care of me.
